title: Error Recovery
description: Demonstrates strategies for handling parse errors gracefully and continuing to parse after failures.

motivation.why: Real-world input often contains errors. A good parser should recover and continue rather than stopping at the first error.
useCases: IDE integration with multiple error markers
Linting tools that report all issues at once
Data validation with comprehensive error reporting

inputFormat.description: Input that may contain syntax errors mixed with valid content.

examples.description: Three segments, middle one is invalid
Key-value pairs with corrupted middle segment

outputFormat.description: Parse results with error information and recovery status.
